alert.note: Alert for Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 09 at 9:07PM EST until January 09 at 9:30PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EST FOR CENTRAL ST. LUCIE AND CENTRAL MARTIN COUNTIES... At 905 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fort Pierce Inlet, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart, and Indiantown. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST for east central Florida. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into a small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
